result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas B. Flynn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling and any follow up as recommended.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 16CF347,17CF921,18CF207,16CF59, 18CF410, 16CM1635 called: 10:31am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Daniel Linehan.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - written victim impact statements filed.

State moves to:
16CF59 - Cts 2-7>>ALL D&RI
18CF410 - Cts. 2-5>>ALL D&RI
16CF347>> D&RI entire file
17CF921>> D&RI entire file
18CF207>> D&RI entire file
16CM1635>> D&RI entire file
16CF347>> D&RI entire file
17CF921>> D&RI entire file
16CM1635>> D&RI entire file

COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
16CF59 - Ct. 1 (Battery by Prisoners/Repeater)>> GUILTY
18CF410 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>> GUILTY
18CF410 - Ct. 6 (DC/DA/Repeater)>> GUILTY

Victim impact statement by D.R.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS:
16CF59 - Ct. 1>> 4 years TOTAL: 2 years incarceration and 2 years ES, I&S; 30 months probation (CORRECTED 5/24/18 clc)
18CF410 - Ct. 1>>4 years TOTAL: 2 years incarceration and 2 year ES, I&S; 18 months probation (CORRECTED 5/24/18 clc)
18CF410 - Ct. 6>>90 days MCJ I&S; 18 months probation.
ALL sentences to run concurrent
CONDITIONS>> Any assessment/treatment/counseling and any follow up as recommended; SAFE program intake/assessment and any follow up recommended; AODA and any follow up; Absolute sobriety; FTE and/or FT employment or combination thereof; No contact with victims unless approved by PO; CC and one domestic abuse assessment; DNA sample and surcharge; Restitution in 18CF207 - $461.00 to D.R.; 18CF410>> 30 days MCJ I&S for rules violations and 30 hours CS I&S for rules violations, and Probation review hearings to be set.

>>CREDIT in 16CF59 - 75 days for time already served; 18CF410 - 17 days of time already served.

18CF410 -- Probation Review Hearing set for 7/20/18 at 1:15pm

Attorney Linehan requests defendant delay reporting to probation until tomorrow as he has employment related appointments to complete today; State requests defendant report by 9:00am tomorrow; Defendant may report to probation by 9:00am tomorrow 5/2/18.
